content.hint: Causing disagreement or discussion
content.explanation: Controversial describes something that causes public disagreement between different people or groups who hold strong opinions about it.
content.contextSentence: The new policy on immigration has proven to be highly controversial.

content.hint: Advanced or complex, showing great knowledge
content.explanation: Sophisticated describes something that is developed to a high degree of complexity or someone who has a lot of worldly experience and knowledge.
content.contextSentence: The restaurant features sophisticated cuisine influenced by French techniques.

content.hint: Showing intense and eager enjoyment or interest
content.explanation: Enthusiastic describes someone who shows strong excitement and interest about something.
content.contextSentence: The audience was enthusiastic about the new play, giving a standing ovation.

content.hint: An official record showing you have finished a training course or have the necessary skills
content.explanation: A qualification is an official record showing that you have finished a training course or have the necessary skills for a job.
content.contextSentence: You need specific qualifications to apply for this teaching position.

content.hint: A fact or event that can be observed
content.explanation: A phenomenon is a fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen, especially one whose cause or explanation is in question.
content.contextSentence: Scientists are studying the phenomenon of bioluminescence in deep-sea creatures.

content.hint: Suitable or easy to use without difficulty
content.explanation: Convenient means fitting in well with a person's needs, activities, and plans, or causing the least difficulty.
content.contextSentence: The hotel is in a convenient location near the train station.

content.hint: The result of something that happened earlier
content.explanation: A consequence is a result or effect of an action or condition.
content.contextSentence: As a consequence of the drought, food prices have risen sharply.

content.hint: A particular way of considering something
content.explanation: A perspective is a particular way of thinking about something, influenced by your beliefs or experiences.
content.contextSentence: The book offers a unique perspective on historical events.

content.hint: Including everything or nearly everything
content.explanation: Comprehensive means including or dealing with all or nearly all elements or aspects of something.
content.contextSentence: The report provides a comprehensive analysis of market trends.

content.hint: The forming of a theory without firm evidence
content.explanation: Speculation is the forming of a theory or conjecture without firm evidence.
content.contextSentence: There's been a lot of speculation about why the CEO resigned so suddenly.

content.hint: Acceptance of the truth or existence of something
content.explanation: Acknowledgment is the acceptance or recognition of the existence or truth of something.
content.contextSentence: His acknowledgment of the mistake was appreciated by everyone.

content.hint: A condition or fact connected with an event
content.explanation: A circumstance is a fact or condition connected with or relevant to an event or action.
content.contextSentence: Under the circumstances, I think we made the right decision.

content.hint: Unusually good, or much better than average
content.explanation: Exceptional means unusual or extraordinary, typically to a significantly high standard.
content.contextSentence: The student's work was truly exceptional, far exceeding expectations.

content.hint: Careful not to cause inconvenience or hurt to others
content.explanation: Considerate describes someone who is careful not to inconvenience or harm others.
content.contextSentence: It was considerate of him to call ahead before visiting.

content.hint: To try to reach an agreement by discussion
content.explanation: To negotiate means to try to reach an agreement or compromise by discussion.
content.contextSentence: The two companies will negotiate the terms of the contract next week.

content.hint: To work together with someone to achieve something
content.explanation: To collaborate means to work jointly with others, especially in an intellectual endeavor.
content.contextSentence: The two companies will collaborate on the new project.

content.hint: The act of explaining the meaning of something
content.explanation: Interpretation is the act of explaining or understanding the meaning of something.
content.contextSentence: Her interpretation of the poem was very insightful.

content.hint: The ability to assess and start things independently
content.explanation: Initiative is the ability to assess and initiate things independently.
content.contextSentence: She took the initiative to organize the meeting.

content.hint: Something that you give or do to help achieve something
content.explanation: A contribution is something that you give or do to help achieve something or make it successful.
content.contextSentence: Everyone made a valuable contribution to the discussion.

content.hint: Large in amount, value, or importance
content.explanation: Substantial means large in amount, value, or importance.
content.contextSentence: They made a substantial investment in new technology.

content.hint: One of two or more available possibilities
content.explanation: An alternative is one of two or more available possibilities.
content.contextSentence: We need to find an alternative solution to this problem.

content.hint: To make someone do or believe something by giving them a good reason
content.explanation: To persuade means to cause someone to do something through reasoning or argument.
content.contextSentence: He managed to persuade his friends to try the new restaurant.

content.hint: Careful thought, typically over a period of time
content.explanation: Consideration is careful thought, typically over a period of time.
content.contextSentence: After careful consideration, she accepted the job offer.

content.hint: Forming a necessary base or core; of central importance
content.explanation: Fundamental means forming a necessary base or core; of central importance.
content.contextSentence: Understanding grammar is fundamental to learning a language.

content.hint: To show clearly how something works or is done
content.explanation: To demonstrate means to show clearly how something works or is done.
content.contextSentence: The teacher will demonstrate the experiment to the class.

content.hint: The quality of being worthy of attention; importance
content.explanation: Significance means the quality of being important or having a special meaning.
content.contextSentence: The discovery is of great significance for science.

content.hint: Consistently good in quality or performance; able to be trusted
content.explanation: Reliable means consistently good in quality or performance; able to be trusted.
content.contextSentence: He is a reliable friend who always keeps his promises.
